DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Quantities of stored Anhydrous Ammonia are below 10,000lb threshold

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Frontier Cooling, Inc.
1  EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


1.1  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Frontier Cooling, Inc. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies are simply designed and implemented to reduce the potential and consequence of accidental releases or emergencies.  The Company endeavors to execute this policy through the daily implementation of its Safety Programs.  Company safety programs include, but are not limited to a comprehensive Process Safety Management Program (PSM).  The PSM Program is an integrated approach to the safe operation of processes using Regulated Substances, and forms the Program Level 3 Prevention Program component of the RMP.  The Frontier Cooling PSM Program is specifically designed and intended to prevent accidental releases, and to deal safely with emergencies if and when they do happen.  It is the primary goal of Frontier Cooling, Inc. to protect its employees, visitors and neighbors from harm due to Company operations.  With this in mind, the priorities of protection of life, the environment, and then property have been established.  Only when these goals have been achieved may the focus shift to resumption of business operations. 

Frontier Cooling also recognizes the need to be prepared to respond safely to accidental releases that could occur should established prevention programs fail. The Company has adopted a ?responding? facility policy and has established an Emergency Action Plan within its California Hazardous Material Business Plan, and an Emergency Response Plan. Emergency response pre-planning is coordinated through the local Certified Unified Program Agency (CUPA), Santa Barbara County Fire Department.  Frontier Cooling has an Emergency Response Team with ammonia technicians that are 1910.120(q) Hazardous Material Technician certified, along with personnel that are Incident Command trained. The Company maintains emergency response equipment and training.  The Emergency Re

sponse team would be notified of an emergency at the facility.  The policy is to maintain adequate and appropriate emergency response resources and training.  

1.2  General Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

The facility is a refrigeration plant located in Santa Maria, CA. and was constructed in 1979.    It is a vegetable and strawberry cooling and shipping facility which operates 12 months per year. The facility provides refrigeration for the removal of field heat from freshly harvested vegetables and strawberries; and subsequent short-term refrigerated storage.  The facility peak season occurs in the months of February through December.    Scheduled maintenance is performed primarily in the winter months.    

The Regulated Substance in use is anhydrous ammonia (NH3).  Refrigeration equipment consists of Pressure Vessels, Vacuum Tubes, Hydrocooler, Compressors, Evaporative Condensers, Pressure Cooling Equipment, Cold Storage Room Evaporators and associated valves, instrumentation and piping.  The vacuum tubes, hydrocooler, and pressure coolers are used to pre-cool agricultural products; the refrigerated storage portion of the facility is used for short-term product storage.  Evaporators in the storage section of the facility maintain temperature until product is sold and shipped.  The refrigeration system is configured in a closed-loop system with isolation and overpressure relief valves installed in key areas.


1.3  General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

Accidental Release Prevention Program

A comprehensive Process Safety Management Program (PSM) has been established in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119 and CCR 8, 5189.  The PSM Program is specifically intended to promote the safe operation of ammonia-handling equipment and process, and to prevent accidental releases.  Frontier Cooling strives to make the PSM Program an integral part of daily Plant operation.  Other safety programs are al

so integrated with the PSM Program, to the extent practicable and appropriate.

Frontier Cooling is the company that maintains the ammonia refrigeration equipment at the site.  It has developed comprehensive written procedures for the operation and maintenance of ammonia-handling equipment, including the steps to be taken in the event of a release or threatened release.  The written procedures include necessary safety precautions for Plant operation, from installation and start-up to daily operation.  The company maintains the refrigeration equipment through a comprehensive Testing, Inspection, and Preventative Maintenance (T/I/PM) Program. The goal of the T/I/PM Program is to operate the refrigeration system safely, and efficiently. The goal is to  minimize breakdowns and catch problems before they pose significant risk to health and safety.  Through this regular routine of test, inspect, carry out scheduled preventative maintenance, Frontier Cooling has reduced equipment operational problems and also reduced the release potential.

Frontier Cooling actively encourages training and continuing education of its management, operators, and mechanics.  Operators, and mechanics, only perform tasks for which they have been pre-qualified by training.

Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Since occupying the facility in 1979, Frontier Cooling has made continuous improvements to the facility and ammonia refrigeration equipment.  Improvements include, but are not limited to:  
?    Self-closing valves were installed as a permissive for oil drain flow
?    Seismic improvements
?    Ammonia/water diffusion system
?    Automated controls and notification system that communicates refrigeration system out-of tolerance parameters through text messaging to management, and staff for early warning and appropriate action.
?    Ammonia detectors and alarms

Other release prevention steps taken at Frontier Cooling, Inc.:

?    Frontier Cooling has enclosed the facility with fencing and gates to limit acces

s to the facility to increase the security of the facility from potential ?wrong-doers?. 
?    All visitors to the facility are required to sign in for permission to enter the facility. 
?    Employees are trained for hazard communication (discovery and communicating) for releases, fires, vandals etc.  Training is documented and maintained in the personnel department. 
?    A digitally recorded security camera system is installed and maintained throughout the facility.
?    Staff is trained in the benefits of good housekeeping.  The general appearance of the facility is maintained on a day-to-day basis.

1.4  Summary of the Five-Year Accident History

The Five-Year Accident History has been reviewed. Frontier Cooling has not experienced any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from covered processes in the last five year period of time that has caused; on-site deaths, on-site injuries, on-site property damage, off-site deaths, off-site injuries, off-site sheltering-in-place, off-site property damage, or off-site environmental damage. Based on the Five-Year Accident History reporting, changes, or modifications are not necessary. 


1.5  The Emergency Response Program

The Emergency Response Program is to ensure that the facility is properly prepared and equipped to respond to a fire, explosion, or an unplanned or accidental discharge of a hazardous substance. This Emergency Response Plan addresses the actions that will be taken.

This plan was designed specifically to conform to the following regulations:
?    Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Process Safety Management (PSM) of Highly Hazardous Chemicals Requirements (29 CFR 1910.119)
?    Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans, 29 CFR 1910.38(a)
?    Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response, 29 CFR 1910.120(q)
?    Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Employee Alarm Systems

, 29 CFR 19 10.165
?    Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Risk Management Programs for Chemical Accidental Release Prevention (40 CFR Part 68)

It is the policy of Frontier Cooling, Inc. to be a ?responding? facility. The Company maintains an emergency response team that is trained to 29 CFR 1910.120q, Hazardous Materials Technician, with 8 hr annual refresher training. Emergency Response equipment is maintained on site. It is company policy  to implement the requirements of this Emergency Response Plan by managing and operating the facility in accordance with the OSHA and EPA regulations and general good operating practices. The objective is to minimize the risk of a fire, explosion, or an accidental hazardous material release. Facility management has developed this Emergency Response Plan to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous material release, fire, explosion, or other emergency situation.

Frontier Cooling, Inc. personnel are expected to cooperate with fellow employees and other support personnel as directed by the emergency response management to assure successful resolution of any emergency.

?    Core Plan
?    Incident Discovery
?    Procedures for Internal Notifications
?    Response Management System
?    Preliminary Assessment of the Situation
?    Establishment of Objectives and Priorities for Response
?    Procedures for Implementation of Tactical Response Plan
?    Procedures for Mobilization of Resources
?    Sustained Actions
?    Termination and Follow-Up Activities


The emergency response plan contains the following annexes:
?    Facility and Locality Information
?    Notification
?    Response Management System
?    Incident Documentation
?    Training and Exercises/Drills
?    Response Critique and Plan Review and Modification Process
?    Prevention    
?    Regulatory Compliance and Cross-Reference Matrices



1.6   Planned changes to improve safety

The primary mechanisms to identify and plan safety improvements include (but are not limited to):

?    Process
